match.title: 2nd ODI
match.statusText: Sri Lanka won by 6 wickets (with 14 balls remaining)

series.name: Sri Lanka in New Zealand ODI Series
series.longName: Sri Lanka in New Zealand ODI Series

image.caption: A wide-angle view of the picturesque Seddon Park in Hamilton
image.longCaption: A wide-angle view of the picturesque Seddon Park in Hamilton, New Zealand v England, 1st Test, Hamilton, March 8, 2008

match.hoursInfo: 14.00 start, First Session 14.00-17.30, Interval 17.30-18.15, Second Session 18.15-21.45

dismissalText.commentary: Brendon McCullum c & b Mendis 117 (99b 12x4 5x6 117m) SR: 118.18

dismissalComment.html: got him! No 200 for McCullum. It was nicely tossed up on off stump, and it wasn't as full as McCullum thought. He checked his drive, and popped it back to Mendis, who took a good low return catch tumbling to his left

dismissalText.commentary: Ross Taylor c Perera b Herath 34 (69b 2x4 0x6 96m) SR: 49.27

dismissalComment.html: ...but that doesn't matter. Herath gets him next ball. He goes for the sweep again, is hurried into the shot by the pace of the ball, and top-edges it high in the air, and Perera settles under it comfortably at short fine leg
gone! That was fired across very quick, back of a length. Latham looked to cut, it was too close to him, and he ended up nicking to the keeper

...but that doesn't matter. Herath gets him next ball. He goes for the sweep again, is hurried into the shot by the pace of the ball, and top-edges it high in the air, and Perera settles under it comfortably at short fine leg

and Milne is dismissed for the first time in international cricket. Down the track, looks to go inside-out over extra cover, and completely misses the ball. His momentum was still taking him down the pitch when the ball reached Sangakkara's gloves. He took his time and removed just one bail, delicately

and that is that. Sees him coming down the track again and bowls it wider and pulls his length back a bit. Goes through with the shot anyway and holes out at long-on. Could be a crucial little contribution from Boult.

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Martin Guptill c Mathews b Kulasekara 10 (19b 2x4 0x6 27m) SR: 52.63

dismissalComment.html: gone! The shot seemed to be on, full and wide, and Guptill tried to launch it over mid-off. Didn't make the connection he wanted, didn't get the elevation he wanted, and he hit it straight to the fielder

dismissalText.commentary: Tom Latham c †Sangakkara b Herath 5 (15b 0x4 0x6 24m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: gone! That was fired across very quick, back of a length. Latham looked to cut, it was too close to him, and he ended up nicking to the keeper

dismissalText.commentary: Brendon McCullum c & b Mendis 117 (99b 12x4 5x6 117m) SR: 118.18

dismissalComment.html: got him! No 200 for McCullum. It was nicely tossed up on off stump, and it wasn't as full as McCullum thought. He checked his drive, and popped it back to Mendis, who took a good low return catch tumbling to his left

dismissalText.commentary: Daniel Vettori run out (Mendis/†Sangakkara) 7 (8b 1x4 0x6 13m) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: He's gone now, Vettori is walking. Taylor goes back to a length ball going across him and works it into the leg side. They go for the single despite the fact that it was hit almost straight to the fielder at short midwicket. Sangakkara did very well to collect Mendis' throw and disturb the bails in one smooth motion, and Vettori knew he was out even though the square leg umpire went upstairs. He was a good couple of yards outside the crease.

dismissalText.commentary: Ross Taylor c Perera b Herath 34 (69b 2x4 0x6 96m) SR: 49.27

dismissalComment.html: ...but that doesn't matter. Herath gets him next ball. He goes for the sweep again, is hurried into the shot by the pace of the ball, and top-edges it high in the air, and Perera settles under it comfortably at short fine leg

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Ronchi run out (Dilshan/†Sangakkara) 0 (0b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Another run-out. What's happening here, New Zealand? It's on the pads, and he tucks it towards short midwicket and sets off. It was straight to Dilshan, and Ronchi - who didn't look like he wanted to run the single but responded to his partner's call anyway - is beaten quite easily by the throw, right over the bails, leaving Sanga an easy job of completing the dismissal

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Corey Anderson run out (Mathews/†Sangakkara) 5 (14b 0x4 0x6 25m) SR: 35.71

dismissalComment.html: Another! This is disastrous from New Zealand. Great work from Mathews at straight midwicket, dives to his right to intercept that back foot punch from Anderson, who set off for the single, thinking he had beaten the fielder. He was stranded halfway down the pitch when Mathews threw to Sangakkara, who had enough time to grab a little snack before taking the bails off if he so wished.

dismissalText.commentary: Nathan McCullum run out (Jayawardene) 13 (26b 2x4 0x6 26m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: and that is number four. It's back of a length on off stump, and he punches it down the ground to mid-off and decides to take on Mahela's arm. Big mistake. Low, flat direct hit and McCullum is nowhere near his crease

dismissalText.commentary: Adam Milne st †Sangakkara b Senanayake 19 (27b 0x4 0x6 30m) SR: 70.37

dismissalComment.html: and Milne is dismissed for the first time in international cricket. Down the track, looks to go inside-out over extra cover, and completely misses the ball. His momentum was still taking him down the pitch when the ball reached Sangakkara's gloves. He took his time and removed just one bail, delicately

dismissalText.commentary: Trent Boult c Thirimanne b Senanayake 13 (6b 0x4 2x6 8m) SR: 216.66

dismissalComment.html: and that is that. Sees him coming down the track again and bowls it wider and pulls his length back a bit. Goes through with the shot anyway and holes out at long-on. Could be a crucial little contribution from Boult.

headshotImage.caption: Matt Henry player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Matt Henry player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c †Ronchi b Henry 116 (127b 17x4 0x6 174m) SR: 91.33

dismissalComment.html: he falls to the short ball after taking Sri Lanka so close! Lots of pace behind this from Henry after two slower balls on the trot and he finds Dilshan slow on the pull. Not often has that happened today, might have been tiring as well. Top edge lobs to the keeper and he walks off to a huge ovation. Top hundred, this

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews not out 39 (46b 5x4 1x6 66m) SR: 84.78

headshotImage.caption: Matt Henry player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Matt Henry player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: he managed a four before, but this time he's picked out the fly slip! Scenes that would not have been out of place at a training session as Mahela opens the face against a short ball and picks Taylor at slip

he falls to the short ball after taking Sri Lanka so close! Lots of pace behind this from Henry after two slower balls on the trot and he finds Dilshan slow on the pull. Not often has that happened today, might have been tiring as well. Top edge lobs to the keeper and he walks off to a huge ovation. Top hundred, this

headshotImage.caption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: up comes the finger and the McCullum gets the breakthrough his brother wanted. Fuller delivery hits middle and skids on to strike Dimuth quite low on the pad, an in his haste to get his bat down, Dimuth was playing around the line of it as well

headshotImage.caption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Dimuth Karunaratne lbw b NL McCullum 21 (38b 3x4 0x6 48m) SR: 55.26

dismissalComment.html: up comes the finger and the McCullum gets the breakthrough his brother wanted. Fuller delivery hits middle and skids on to strike Dimuth quite low on the pad, an in his haste to get his bat down, Dimuth was playing around the line of it as well

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Latham b Milne 38 (41b 1x4 3x6 39m) SR: 92.68

dismissalComment.html: in the air.... and Sanga has picked out deep square leg! Short ball on middle, comes at the batsman with a bit too much heat for the pull shot. Latham runs in and dives forward to complete a potentially important catch.

headshotImage.caption: Matt Henry player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Matt Henry player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Taylor b Henry 27 (29b 5x4 0x6 31m) SR: 93.1

dismissalComment.html: he managed a four before, but this time he's picked out the fly slip! Scenes that would not have been out of place at a training session as Mahela opens the face against a short ball and picks Taylor at slip

headshotImage.caption: Matt Henry player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Matt Henry player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c †Ronchi b Henry 116 (127b 17x4 0x6 174m) SR: 91.33

dismissalComment.html: he falls to the short ball after taking Sri Lanka so close! Lots of pace behind this from Henry after two slower balls on the trot and he finds Dilshan slow on the pull. Not often has that happened today, might have been tiring as well. Top edge lobs to the keeper and he walks off to a huge ovation. Top hundred, this

headshotImage.caption: Matt Henry player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Matt Henry player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: drummed to the square leg boundary! Took on the short ball that was rising over his head and pulled it away powerfully to seal Sri Lanka's first win on the tour

commentPostTextItems.html: So that wraps things up at Hamilton. The cricket caravan will more on to Auckland now on Saturday. So do join us then. Thank you for your company, and do keep an eye out for Andrew Fernando's match report

"Good surface for batting, came on nicely. Really enjoyed myself, it was my home ground in 2010 when I came here. Enjoying my bowling as well, got more than 20 wickets in the last six months. Didn't turn much, but I put the ball in the right areas and made the batsman make the play," says Tillakaratne Dilshan, the Man of the Match

"Four run-outs is not good enough," says Brendon McCullum. "Little bit of panic set in and something we've prided on not doing too much recently. We were threatening a 300 score, but not good enough. But we just have to learn from the mistakes. It was a 290-300 wicket, some of the bowlers bowled really well and they will be better for the experience. But against a player like Dilshan in that form, it can be daunting. Everyone knows it's tough on Henry and Neesham, but we can only have 15. But it's a good experience and with three weeks left, they might still be included in the World Cup. Frustrating that I was dismissed before the powerplay, and not being able to set up a good total"

"Pretty pleasing with the way the boys went about things," says Angelo Mathews. "They got off to a brilliant start, McCullum batted very well but our spinners pulled things back and the fielders made four run-outs. Clinical work. Pitch looked slow so we brought Herath in and it worked. We need to continue in the same manner, working very hard on the fielding. Brilliant innings from Dilshan, we want one of the top four to bat through the innings"

9.10 pm The players shake hands under the backdrop of a rosy sunset. There appeared to be only one result as soon as Tillakaratne Dilshan took control. His drives were sumptuous, his pulls blared authority and his hunt for singles was never-ending. Quite the template for an openers' innings during a chase. But his 19th ODI ton became match-winning because Sri Lanka's spinners and fielders had turned the tables on a rampaging New Zealand innings earlier. Stay with us for the presentation

Tom: "This shows exactly why Sri Lanka should play to their strengths. Herath is a world class spinner and should always be included in the team rather than a 3rd fast bowler who wouldn't be anywhere near the team if not for these "fast bowlers'" pitches"

commentTextItems.html: sprawls down into the pitch on the followthrough after a third accurate short ball in a row. Thirimanne hops up and tucks it behind square leg
beautifully done again. Short ball right over middle stump forces Thirimanne to bend out of the way
bouncer again on middle and off, Thirimanne sways away
fuller delivery on middle and leg, Mathews whips but finds mid-on

commentPostTextItems.html: Brad: "The two things NZ would have wanted from this match are Milne to show he's better than Henry and runs from somebody other than McCullum. Oops."

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Matt Henry player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Matt Henry player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: low full toss on off stump, tapped to short cover
goes short on leg stump and Mathews has helped it on its way to the fine leg boundary. Only two left to get now
fuller delivery on middle, Mathews turns it to midwicket
down the track and smears a good length ball through extra cover. Ranks among the best shots of the day
fuller delivery outside off, Mathews defends into the covers
shortish and outside off, whipped to long-on

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Matt Henry player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Matt Henry player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: back of a length on middle and leg, flicked to long leg
another bouncer to the new batsman and Thirimanne tucks his head under his armpit

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c †Ronchi b Henry 116 (127b 17x4 0x6 174m) SR: 91.33

commentTextItems.html: he falls to the short ball after taking Sri Lanka so close! Lots of pace behind this from Henry after two slower balls on the trot and he finds Dilshan slow on the pull. Not often has that happened today, might have been tiring as well. Top edge lobs to the keeper and he walks off to a huge ovation. Top hundred, this
fuller and slower delivery on middle and leg, gets an inside edge towards short midwicket
fuller delivery, slower too, as Mathews recognises it and clips through mdiwicket

commentPostTextItems.html: Matt Henry comes back. But with 13 needed off 30, what can he do?

commentTextItems.html: good length on off stump at 143 kph, pushed to mid-off

commentPostTextItems.html: Muhammad: "Dilshans scored a 54 vs Milne in 32 balls. Wooowww. he has scored 54 of the 61 runs that Milne has conceded"

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentTextItems.html: they're just having fun out there now. Or Dilshan might be tiring as he slogs at a fuller delivery outside off and gets the outside half of the bat to mid-off
full on off stump and this was at 140kph, Dilshan planted his front foot in line with it and walloped it barely over the bowler's head. Time for them to run in with helmets?
that's the slower short ball, picked up and pummeled over the wide long-on boundary. Magnificent striking

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c †Ronchi b Henry 116 (127b 17x4 0x6 174m) SR: 91.33

dismissalComment.html: he falls to the short ball after taking Sri Lanka so close! Lots of pace behind this from Henry after two slower balls on the trot and he finds Dilshan slow on the pull. Not often has that happened today, might have been tiring as well. Top edge lobs to the keeper and he walks off to a huge ovation. Top hundred, this

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Latham b Milne 38 (41b 1x4 3x6 39m) SR: 92.68

dismissalComment.html: in the air.... and Sanga has picked out deep square leg! Short ball on middle, comes at the batsman with a bit too much heat for the pull shot. Latham runs in and dives forward to complete a potentially important catch.

headshotImage.caption: Matt Henry player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Matt Henry player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Taylor b Henry 27 (29b 5x4 0x6 31m) SR: 93.1

dismissalComment.html: he managed a four before, but this time he's picked out the fly slip! Scenes that would not have been out of place at a training session as Mahela opens the face against a short ball and picks Taylor at slip

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews not out 39 (46b 5x4 1x6 66m) SR: 84.78

dismissalComment.html: up comes the finger and the McCullum gets the breakthrough his brother wanted. Fuller delivery hits middle and skids on to strike Dimuth quite low on the pad, an in his haste to get his bat down, Dimuth was playing around the line of it as well

stories.subTitle: 2nd ODI, Hamilton

stories.title: McCullum rues New Zealand's running meltdown
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Hamilton
stories.seoTitle: Brendon McCullum rues New Zealand's running meltdown
stories.summary: New Zealand were guilty of cracking under the pressure created by the Sri Lanka fielders, Brendon McCullum said, after four run-outs in New Zealand's innings prevented his side from posting a competitive total

stories.title: Dilshan, spinners, run outs foil NZ
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Hamilton
stories.seoTitle: Dilshan, spinners, run outs foil New Zealand
stories.summary: Sri Lanka sauntered to their first victory of the New Zealand tour, after Tillakaratne Dilshan hit a breezy 116 on a fine batting surface at Seddon Park
stories.byline: The Report by Andrew Fidel Fernando

stories.title: New Zealand not risking burnout - Taylor
stories.subTitle: World Cup 2015
stories.seoTitle: New Zealand not risking burnout - Taylor
stories.summary: New Zealand's heavy schedule before the World Cup is no more taxing than that of several other teams, Ross Taylor has said

stories.title: SL seek upsurge against injury-hit hosts
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Hamilton
stories.seoTitle: SL seek upsurge against injury-hit hosts
stories.summary: With no wins yet on the tour, Sri Lanka will hope to convert the glimpses of potential they have shown into a complete performance in the second ODI
